summary: The diff implements most of the required features for the ZENTEK e-commerce app. Frontend pages, contexts, components, and routing are all present. The backend Motoko actor exists but uses incorrect seeded product data (wrong names, images, prices) instead of the 5 specified ZENTEK products. Several pages referenced in App.tsx were omitted from the diff due to truncation limits, making full verification difficult for those pages.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend Motoko actor must seed all 5 ZENTEK products with correct names, imageUrls, prices, MRPs, descriptions, keyFeatures, and codAvailable flags (AuraBuds Pro, NightDock, SnapGrip, HyperKey, LumiCam).
missing_requirements.reason: The backend/main.mo seeds products named 'ZENTEK Solar Power Bank', 'ZENTEK UV Water Purifier', 'ZENTEK Eco-Friendly LED Bulbs', etc. â€” not the required 5 ZENTEK products with their specified prices and image URLs.

missing_requirements.requirement: Expose createUser() and loginUser() functions on the backend actor for basic auth with email and password.
missing_requirements.reason: The backend actor exposes saveCallerUserProfile/getCallerUserProfile using Principal-based identity, but no explicit createUser() or loginUser() functions with email/password are visible in the diff.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend actor uses Internet Identity Principal-based access control with MixinAuthorization and MixinStorage components, adding blob storage and role-based access control.
hallucinated_features.reason: The spec requires a simple Motoko actor with product/user/order storage only. No access control middleware, blob storage mixin, or Principal-based user profiles were requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Product sort functionality (priceAscending/priceDescending) implemented in the backend Product module.
hallucinated_features.reason: No sorting capability was requested in the build spec.

hallucinated_features.description: Checkout page integrates with Internet Identity (useInternetIdentity) and the backend actor (useCreateOrder) for order placement, tying the checkout flow to ICP authentication.
hallucinated_features.reason: The spec allows all persistence in localStorage with mock auth and does not require Internet Identity integration in the checkout flow.
